name: Taiwanese Popcorn Chicken
description: My version of Taiwanese popcorn chicken with a Vietnamese flair. This easy recipe delivers crispy, bite-size pieces of chicken, seasoned to perfection. Make it for a gathering or a quick snack. It's a guaranteed crowd pleaser.
keywords: Vietnamese popcorn chicken, Vietnamese basil popcorn chicken, Vietnamese popcorn chicken with rau ram, basil, Asian popcorn chicken, Asian popcorn chicken recipe, chicken thigh, chicken breast, five spice powder, chicken bouillon powder, asian recipe, Taiwanese popcorn chicken, Taiwanese basil popcorn chicken, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, sugar, popcorn chicken recipe, easy popcorn chicken recipe, easy Asian popcorn chicken recipe, popular Asian recipe, popular Asian snack recipe, boba popcorn chicken, boba popcorn chicken recipe, bubble tea popcorn chicken, bubble tea popcorn chicken recipe, Vietnamese fried chicken recipe, Vietnamese bite-size fried chicken, Taiwanese fried chicken recipe, Taiwanese street food, Taiwanese street food recipe, Taiwanese popcorn chicken reasoning, Vietnamese popcorn chicken seasoning, how to make Taiwanese popcorn chicken, how to make Taiwanese basil popcorn chicken, Vietnamese coriander, Vietnamese mint, rau ram

video.name: Taiwanese Popcorn Chicken (My Vietnamese Way)
video.description: My version of Taiwanese popcorn chicken with a Vietnamese flair. This easy recipe delivers crispy, bite-size pieces of chicken, seasoned to perfection. Make it for a gathering or a quick snack. It's a guaranteed crowd pleaser.

recipeIngredient: Handful of basil leaves (or Vietnamese coriander)
recipeInstructions: Prepare the Chicken: Cut chicken thighs into 1-inch cubes and marinate with salt, sugar, chicken bouillon powder, ground black pepper, and five-spice powder for at least 30 minutes.
Prepare Seasoning Mix: In a small bowl, mix salt and ground black pepper. Set aside.
Coat the Chicken: Add a beaten egg and flour to the chicken. Mix well until you get a wet batter coating the chicken.

Fry and Season: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet until it reaches 375°F. Carefully add chicken in batches, frying until golden brown and crispy, about 4 minutes per batch. Remove and drain on a paper towel-lined plate or wire basket. Sprinkle the seasoning mix over hot chicken. Toss to combine. You can enjoy as or continue to add the fried basil.
Fry Herbs and Serve: Ensure leaves are completely dry. Fry in the oil until crispy, about 30 seconds. Transfer crispy chicken to a platter and top with fried herb.
